item.title: Graph Search Algorithms
item.description: Revise about many graph-searching related algorithms. DFS: Depth First Search Search till the leaf vertex then choose another path. It will find a path between two vertices and it’s guaranteed to do so, however it is not guaranteed to find the shortest path. works on graphs that are: connected unweighted directed Uses a stack data structure to traverse all nodes in a graph. Steps of the algorithm: push the root vertex to the stack while the vertex is not empty pop a vertex out of the stack if the vertex is: the destination, then end search marked visited, then continue unvisited: mark it as visited add its unvisited neighbors to the stack BFS: Breadth First Search Search all neighbors of a vertex then move on next level.
